member.name: T:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.ObjectPool`1
member.summary:
Generic implementation of object pooling pattern with predefined pool size limit. The main purpose is that limited number of frequently used objects can be kept in the pool for further recycling.
Notes: 1) it is not the goal to keep all returned objects. Pool is not meant for storage. If there is no space in the pool, extra returned objects will be dropped.
2) it is implied that if object was obtained from a pool, the caller will return it back in a relatively short time. Keeping checked out objects for long durations is ok, but reduces usefulness of pooling. Just new up your own.
Not returning objects to the pool in not detrimental to the pool's work, but is a bad practice. Rationale: If there is no intent for reusing the object, do not use pool - just use "new".

member.name: T:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.ObjectPool`1.Factory
member.remarks: Not using System.Func{T} because this file is linked into the (debugger) Formatter, which does not have that type (since it compiles against .NET 2.0).

member.name: M:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.ObjectPool`1.Allocate
member.summary: Produces an instance.
member.remarks: Search strategy is a simple linear probing which is chosen for it cache-friendliness. Note that Free will try to store recycled objects close to the start thus statistically reducing how far we will typically search.

member.name: M:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.ObjectPool`1.Free(`0)
member.summary: Returns objects to the pool.
member.remarks: Search strategy is a simple linear probing which is chosen for it cache-friendliness. Note that Free will try to store recycled objects close to the start thus statistically reducing how far we will typically search in Allocate.

member.name: T:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.Theming.IThemeSelector
member.summary: When implemented, defines a way to provide specific themes for the current request. The results of all implementations are then ordered by priority, and the result with the highest priority is selected as the current theme.

member.name: M:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.Theming.IThemeSelector.GetThemeAsync
member.summary: Returns a representing a specific theme and a priority order. The highest priority value will be used.

member.name: T:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.Theming.ThemeLayout
member.summary:
This class represents a precompiled _Layout.cshtml view that renders a Layout shape and the View's body in its Content zone.
1- Views look for any _ViewStart.cshtml 2- has registered as the top one 3- then set a special Layout filename as the default View's Layout. 4- has registered for this special filename. 5- evaluates the Body of the view, and renders a Layout shape with this Body in the Content zone.

member.summary: Represents a result for a selected theme.

member.summary: Gets or sets the theme name.
member.remarks: This is the theme identifier. By default this is also the theme name, but if a custom identifier has been specified, please use the identifier.

member.name: T:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.Zones.ZoneHolding
member.summary:
Provides the behavior of shapes that have a Zones property. Examples include Layout and Item
* Returns a fake parent object for zones Foo.Zones
* Foo.Zones.Alpha : Foo.Zones["Alpha"] Foo.Alpha :same.

member.name: T:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.Zones.ZoneOnDemand
member.remarks: InterfaceProxyBehavior(). NilBehavior() => return Nil on GetMember and GetIndex in all cases. ZoneOnDemandBehavior(_zoneFactory, _parent, name) => when a zone (Shape) is created, replace itself with the zone so that Layout.ZoneName is no more equal to Nil.

member.name: T:OrchardCore.DisplayManagement.Zones.Zones
member.remarks: Returns a ZoneOnDemand object the first time the indexer is invoked. If an item is added to the ZoneOnDemand then the zoneFactory is invoked to create a zone shape and this item is added to the zone. Then the zone shape is assigned in place of the ZoneOnDemand. A ZoneOnDemand returns true when compared to null such that we can do Zones["Foo"] == null to see if anything has been added to a zone, without instantiating a zone when accessing the indexer.
